Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2008 05:36PM karenbarrows wrote: I WILL BE STARTING AC EVERY TWO WEEKS ON OCTOBER 20TH. CAN YOU TELL ME HOW I CAN PREPARE NOW THAT YOU HAVE LIVED IT? SIDE EFFECTS ETC. HAVE YOU STARTED TO LOSE YOUR HAIR? HAVE YOU BEEN ABLE TO WORK? ANY HELP WILL BE GREATLY APPRECIATED. THANK YOU THANK YOU KAREN
Posts.Title: AC every 2 weeks..? susan13 Keryl

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2008 08:04AM karenbarrows wrote: HI, I DID HAVE MY LYMPH NODES REMOVED AND MY TUMOR WAS ONLY 0.7 CM. NODES WERE NEGATIVE. I'M 48 AND STARTING CHEMO OCT 20TH. IT IS ANOTHER INSURANCE POLICY FOR US. DO YOU HAVE AN INVASIVE CANCER? ANY WAY I HAD THE SAME THOUGHTS. WE ARE NOT OLD. IN FACT MY ONCOLOGIST SAID IF I WAS 85 SHE WOULDN'T EVEN RECOMMEND IT BUT HEY YOUNG CHICK WE ARE STILL YOUNG. SO I AM TAKING EVERYTHING I CAN. 8 WEEKS OF YUCK FOR WHO KNOWS HOW MANY MORE YEARS. LET ME KNOW WHAT YOU DECIDE.
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Oct 22, 2008 01:38PM karenbarrows wrote: HI, I JUST HAD MY FIRST AC TREATMENT TWO DAYS AGO. I FELT AWFUL YESTERDAY. NAUSEA,VOMITING DIZZY, JUST CRAP. TODAY I FEEL BETTER THOUGH AND PLAN TO BE AT WORK TOMORROW. WHEN EVERYONE SAYS THEY WORKED THROUGH THEIR CHEMO DO THE MEAN THEY  NEVER MISSED A DAY?? I KNOW I COULDN'T HAVE MADE IT YESTERDAY OR TODAY. AND I LOVE MY JOB. CAN SOMEONE LET ME KNOW IF THE DAY AFTER IS TRULY THE WORST DAY. I HAVE HEARD SO MANY DIFFERENT SE'S. I KNOW WE ARE ALL DIFFERENT BUT THERE MUST BE SOME KIND OF STANDARD. I REALLY NEED YOU GUYS RIGHT NOW. I DON'T SEEM TO BE TOO UPBEAT RIGHT NOW BUT I PLAN FOR THIS TO BE A "PAY IT FORWARD" MOMENT AND I WILL HELP SOMEONE IN THE FUTURE. THANKS KAREN

I'm sure it will feel better when the scalp is actually smooth. Let me know how you are doing? I'm meeting a friend at Hearth N Kettle tomorrow at ten am. If you are around you can't miss me. I'll be wearing a brown hat. Love Karen
